title.narrative: Construction of a child protection centre in Mbuyi Mayi and Evaluation

description.narrative: As part of activities to respond to the humanitarian crises in Mbuyi Mayi, AA DRC commenced the construction of a child protection centre to cater for the needs of unaccompanied children who were displaced as a result of the conflict. Part of the funds will be used to complete the facility which will be handed over to the community after its completion. As part of Accountability Learning and Planning Systems, AA DRC is required to conduct a review of programmes and interventions to ensure tracking of ongoing learning and critical reflection on changes that took place through engagement with people living in poverty and stakeholders are tracked. Part of the funds will be used to review AA DRC’s achievements and lessons learnt in terms of humanitarian work in order to map out new strategies for continuous action. The rest of the funds will be used to support the country programme in meeting staff costs.

organisation.narrative: ActionAid UK - Philanthropy and Partnerships Team

humanitarian-scope.narrative: The DRC's Ministry of Health declared a measles outbreak in the country on 10 June 2019. Between January and August 2019, measles infected more than 145,000 people and killed 2,758 people
